item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "An Assassin, a real Assassin had to look like one-black clothes, hood, boots, and all. If they could wear any clothes, any disguise, then what could anyone do but spend all day in a small room with a loaded crossbow pointed at the door?" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If cats looked like frogs we'd realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That's what people remember." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Studies have shown that an ant can carry one hundred times its own weight, but there is no known limit to the lifting power of the average tiny eighty-year-old Spanish peasant grandmother." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'd rather be a rising ape than a falling angel." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Chaos is found in greatest abundance wherever order is being sought. It always defeats order, because it is better organized." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It would seem that you have no useful skill or talent whatsoever," he said. "Have you thought of going into teaching?" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Everything starts somewhere, though many physicists disagree. But people have always been dimly aware of the problem with the start of things. They wonder how the snowplough driver gets to work, or how the makers of dictionaries look up the spelling of words." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Nanny Ogg looked under her bed in case there was a man there. Well, you never knew your luck." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "No matter what she did with her hair it took about three minutes for it to tangle itself up again, like a garden hosepipe in a shed [Which, no matter how carefully coiled, will always uncoil overnight and tie the lawnmower to the bicycles]." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Blessings be on this house," Granny said, perfunctorily. It was always a good opening remark for a witch. It concentrated people's minds on what other things might be on this house." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "He'd been wrong, there was a light at the end of the tunnel, and it was a flamethrower." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Insanity is catching." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "To call you excrement would be an insult to the product of my bowels." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "The paintings of Francis Bacon to my eye are very beautiful. The paintings of Bosch or Goya are to my eye very beautiful. I've also stood in front of those same paintings with people who've said, 'let's get on to the Botticellis as soon as possible.' I have lingered, of course." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Gabe495 add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "This is how humans are: We question all our beliefs, except for the ones that we really believe in, and those we never think to question." -- Orson Scott Card
